meanings.definition: Capable of being measured or estimated.
meanings.sent1: The length of the table was gaugeable with a ruler.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a gaugeable scale to weigh the apples.
meanings.sent3: It was a gaugeable challenge to guess the number of jellybeans in the jar.
meanings.sent4: Her progress in math was as gaugeable as the height of a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the concept of fractions more gaugeable by using pizza slices.

meanings.definition: Able to be assessed or evaluated.
meanings.sent1: The quality of the fabric was gaugeable by its softness.
meanings.sent2: The student's performance in the test was easily gaugeable.
meanings.sent3: It was gaugeable that the cat enjoyed the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as gaugeable as the depth of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the new policy was gaugeable through the increase in productivity.
